language.name: gb
language.keywords: larn, manager, repositories, web pages, offline, documentation, frameworks, programming languages, visualization, offline, without internet, Blinke, platforms, selfhosting, open source
language.description: Larn is an open source application that allows managing repositories of downloaded web pages for offline viewing, designed especially for documentation of programming languages and frameworks. The application is compatible with multiple platforms and offers the option of self-hosting.

hero.title: A new way to learn
hero.subtitle: Larn is an offline web pages manager, focused on knowledge, to facilitate access to documentations without internet.

features.title: A new way to learn anywhere

first.title: Open source
first.subtitle: Larn is open source, so anyone can collaborate with its development and add new components.

second.title: Self hosting
second.subtitle: Being open source, anyone can deploy it wherever they want without any limits on functionality.

third.title: Native
third.subtitle: Larn does not interfere with the pages it stores, they have the same content and design as the official page.

fourth.title: Versatility
fourth.subtitle: Blinke offers the possibility of limited or complete free and paid hosting of Larn so you don't have to deal with self-hosting.

services.title: Advantages of Larn over other applications

first.title: Comfort
first.subtitle: With Larn you can view the information you want or need natively, it does not transcribe text to another format that is not original HTML, CSS and Javascript.

second.title: Security
second.subtitle: Larn is open source, so you can know exactly what you are downloading, at the same time we do not collect any information from our Free, Plus or Permanent users.

third.title: Universal
third.subtitle: Larn can be compiled for a diverse amount of platforms, so you can use it wherever you want, and if it doesn't exist, you can create it.

fourth.title: Create and publish your own repositories

second.title: Unlimited access to Blinke and external repositories

fourth.title: Create and publish your own repositories

first.title: Can Larn manage more than just offline websites?
first.subtitle: Yes, we plan on more functionalities.
first.content: We plan on helping manage personal books to have them on all your devices, video courses, quick deployment of projects and APIs to help sites natively be offline. Among other features that anyone can suggest or develop.

second.title: What is the difference between self-hosting and Plus/Permanent?
second.subtitle: A few, but due to technical limitations.
second.content: Plus offers all the features in an annual/monthly subscription model, but for large groups (such as companies or organizations) we propose custom models to streamline use in groups of many people, such as diversified access levels in various united groups, this combining Larn with other utilities such as Learth. Permanent offers the same as Plus except for large extensions of features, which with a permanent license can be chosen to finance based on the calculation of the cost of deploying that new functionality on our servers. Self-hosting Larn allows you to have all the functionalities and customize Larn as you wish, combining it with whichever tools you want, we can achieve something similar without conflicts by contacting us privately if you are an organization.

third.title: Can I help distribute Larn on my own?
third.subtitle: Yes! Larn is completely free.
third.content: You can charge for deploying Larn in organizations or for distributing it, we offer everything necessary to use Larn, but we do not take responsibility for what the rest does with it, therefore you have complete freedom to do whatever you want with Larn, however neither Blinke nor its collaborators will be responsible for misuse.

fourth.title: What about privacy in Free, Plus, and Permanent?
fourth.subtitle: All the information we collect is customizable.
fourth.content: We offer different functionalities that require certain personal information, such as Token Registry which collects the public IP address to prevent cookie theft, or certain metrics that help us understand more easily the use that users give to Larn. ALL functionalities that require personal information are disabled by default, you can use Larn without giving any personal information being completely anonymous. You can request any information we store about you, you can clean it at any time and know how it is stored and the security methods.

available.subtitle: Take advantage and facilitate your access to knowledge like never before
